shortBio: A celebrity chef and television personality from the UK known for his fiery temperament and Michelin-starred restaurants. He has hosted several cooking shows, including 'Hell's Kitchen' and 'MasterChef.'

recipes.name: Tom Kha Gai
recipes.ingredients: 1 can coconut milk ,1 cup chicken broth , 1 lemongrass stalk,1 lemongrass stalk, 2-3 kaffir lime leaves, 1-2 Thai bird's eye chilies, 1-2 garlic cloves, 1-2 inch piece of galangal, 1-2 chicken breasts, 1-2 tablespoons fish sauce,1-2 tablespoons lime juice, 1 handful of fresh cilantro leaves
recipes.cooking_method: In a pot, bring coconut milk and chicken broth to a simmer. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chilies, and garlic. Add galangal and chicken breasts, and simmer until chicken is cooked. Season with fish sauce and lime juice, and garnish with cilantro leaves.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.ingredients: 8 oz. rice noodles, 1-2 chicken breasts, 1-2 tablespoons oil, 1-2 shallots, 1-2 garlic cloves, 1-2 eggs, 1-2 tablespoons fish sauce, 1-2 tablespoons sugar, 1-2 tablespoons tamarind paste, 1 cup bean sprouts, 1/4 cup peanuts, 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
recipes.cooking_method: Soak the rice noodles in warm water until softened. Cook the chicken in a pan with oil, shallots, and garlic. Push the chicken to the side and scramble the eggs in the same pan. Add the rice noodles, fish sauce, sugar, and tamarind paste, and stir-fry until well-combined. Add the bean sprouts and peanuts, and stir-fry for an additional minute.Garnish with cilantro and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Green Curry
cooking_method: In a pot, bring coconut milk and green curry paste to a boil.
Add chicken, eggplants, bell peppers, and kaffir lime leaves, and simmer until chicken is cooked.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar, and garnish with Thai basil leaves.

shortBio: A pioneer of French cuisine in the US, Julia Child was a cookbook author and television host who popularized French cooking in America. She authored the famous cookbook 'Mastering the Art of French Cooking' and hosted the TV show 'The French Chef.'

recipe1.name: Tom Yum Soup
recipe1.ingredients: shrimp, mushrooms, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chili peppers
recipe1.cooking_method: 1. Bring chicken stock to a boil. Add lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves and simmer for 5 minutes. 2. Add mushrooms and cook for 2-3 minutes. 3. Add shrimp and chili peppers and cook for 2-3 minutes or until shrimp are cooked. 4. Season with fish sauce and lime juice. Serve hot.

recipe2.name: Pad Thai
recipe2.ingredients: rice noodles, chicken, bean sprouts, tofu, eggs, peanuts
recipe2.cooking_method: 1. Soak rice noodles in hot water for 10-15 minutes. 2. Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry chicken until cooked. 3. Add tofu, eggs, bean sprouts and drained rice noodles. 4. Stir-fry until the noodles are cooked. 5. Add peanuts and serve with lime wedges.

recipe3.name: Green Curry
recipe3.ingredients: chicken, green curry paste, coconut milk, eggplant, bamboo shoots
recipe3.cooking_method: 1. Heat oil in a wok and fry green curry paste until fragrant. 2. Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked. 3. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 4. Add eggplant and bamboo shoots and simmer until vegetables are tender. 5. Serve with rice.

shortBio: A chef, author, and television host, Anthony Bourdain was known for his adventurous spirit and love of global cuisine. He hosted several popular TV shows, including  'No Reservations' and 'Parts Unknown'

recipe1.name: Tom Kha Gai
recipe1.ingredients: coconut milk, chicken, galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, mushrooms
recipe1.cooking_method: 1. Boil coconut milk, galangal, and lemongrass in a pot. 2. Add chicken and mushrooms. 3. Add kaffir lime leaves and simmer. 4. Serve hot.

recipe2.name: Pad See Ew
recipe2.ingredients: wide rice noodles, chicken, eggs, soy sauce, oyster sauce, garlic
recipe2.cooking_method: 1. Soak rice noodles in hot water until soft. 2. Fry garlic in a wok. 3. Add chicken and eggs. 4. Add noodles and sauces. 5. Serve hot.

recipe3.name: Massaman Curry
recipe3.ingredients: beef, potatoes, onions, peanuts, coconut milk, Massaman curry paste
recipe3.cooking_method: 1. Boil beef and potatoes in a pot. 2. Fry onions and peanuts in a pan. 3. Add Massaman curry paste and coconut milk. 4. Add beef and potatoes. 5. Simmer and serve hot.

shortBio: : A celebrity chef and television personality, Rachael Ray has hosted several cooking shows, including '30 Minute Meals' and 'The Rachael Ray Show.'  She has authored several cookbooks and owns a line of cookware and kitchenware products.

recipe1.name: Papaya Salad (Som Tam)
recipe1.ingredients: 1 green papaya, 2 garlic cloves, 2-3 bird's eye chilies, 1/4 cup peanuts, 1 tbsp palm sugar, 2 tbsp fish sauce, 1 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp dried shrimp (optional), 2-3 cherry tomatoes
recipe1.cooking_method:
1. Peel and shred the green papaya using a shredder or a mandoline slicer. Set aside.
2. In a mortar and pestle, pound the garlic and chilies together until they form a paste. Add the peanuts and lightly crush them.
3. Add the palm sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice to the mortar and mix everything together.
4. Add the shredded papaya and dried shrimp (if using) to the mortar and toss everything together until the papaya is coated in the sauce.
5. Serve with sliced cherry tomatoes on top.

recipe2.name: Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai)
recipe2.ingredients: wide rice noodles, chicken, eggs, soy sauce, oyster sauce, garlic
recipe2.cooking_method: 1. Soak rice noodles in hot water until soft. 2. Fry garlic in a wok. 3. Add chicken and eggs. 4. Add noodles and sauces. 5. Serve hot.

recipe3.name: Massaman Curry
recipe3.ingredients: 1 lb ground chicken, 2 garlic cloves, 2-3 bird's eye chilies, 1 onion, 1 bell pepper, 1/2 cup basil leaves, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tsp sugar, 2 tbsp oil
recipe3.cooking_method:
1. Peel and mince the garlic. Thinly slice the onion and bell pepper. Roughly chop the basil leaves.
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over high heat. Add the garlic and chilies and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
3. Add the ground chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, breaking up any clumps with a spatula.
4. Add the onion and bell pepper and stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
5. Add the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar to
